meanings.definition: To take back possession of something, especially through legal means.
meanings.sent1: The bank repossesses the car when the owner cannot make payments.
meanings.sent2: The landlord repossesses the apartment after the tenant breaks the lease.
meanings.sent3: The magician repossesses the rabbit from the hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Time repossesses our youth, leaving us with memories of days gone by.
meanings.sent5: The government repossesses the land for public use, changing the landscape forever.

meanings.definition: To regain ownership of property due to failure to make payments.
meanings.sent1: She repossesses her car after falling behind on loan payments.
meanings.sent2: The bank repossesses the house when the mortgage is not paid.
meanings.sent3: The student repossesses the textbook after realizing it was overdue at the library.
meanings.sent4: Hope repossesses the heart of the homeowner as they work to pay off the debt.
meanings.sent5: Determination repossesses the mind of the borrower, pushing them to settle the arrears.

meanings.definition: To reclaim or retrieve something that was previously owned.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist repossesses the ancient artifact from the museum.
meanings.sent2: The family repossesses their heirloom jewelry from the pawn shop.
meanings.sent3: The cat repossesses its favorite toy from under the couch, much to the owner's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Memories repossess the mind, bringing back moments of joy and sorrow.
meanings.sent5: Nostalgia repossesses the heart, longing for the days of innocence and laughter.
